title: Chromecast Icon
custom_preconds:
GIVEN AtBat has been installed
AND the user is on the same network as a Google Chromecast device

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the section header (e.g. Scoreboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Google Cast icon will be present in the top right corner of the screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Google Cast icon located on the top right corner of the EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an overlay will display
AND all Chromecast devices found on the network will appear
AND all device names will display correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on the Google Cast icon
AND the 'Cast to Device' overlay appears
AND the user selects an available chromecast device
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'Cast to Device' overlay will dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user chooses the Cast icon
AND the user selects a device
AND the device selection overlay dismisses
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Google Cast icon will show as enabled
AND it will now appear filled in with white

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects the enabled Google Cast icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see a Disconnect option ("Stop Casting")
AND this will be selectable

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on the enabled Google Cast icon
AND the user selects Disconnect
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the device selection overlay will dismiss
AND the Google Cast will be disabled
AND the Cast icon will deactivate

title: Playing MLB.TV without connecting to Google Cast yet
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the At Bat app has been installed
AND the user is on the same network as a Google Chromecast device
AND the user has navigated to the MLB.TV menu 
(Verify Chromecast button appears in header)
custom_steps: When the user starts an MLB.TV stream
custom_expected:
Then the stream should start up without issue
And the user should see a Chromecast button on the MLB.TV player UI

title: Playing MLB.TV while connected to Google Cast
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the At Bat app has been installed
AND the user is on the same network as a Google Chromecast device
AND the user has navigated to the MLB.TV menu 
AND the user has connected their device to a Google Cast device
(Verify Chromecast icon is highlighted white)
custom_steps: When the user taps on an MLB.TV stream
custom_expected:
Then the stream should launch on the Chromecast device
And the user should be taken to the video controller view on their handset

title: Casting MLB.TV from media player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the AtBat app has been installed
AND the user is on the same network as a Google Chromecast device
AND the user has started an MLB.TV stream

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Google Cast icon located on the MLB.TV player UI
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an overlay will display
AND all Chromecast devices found on the network will appear
AND all device names will display correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on the Google Cast icon located on the MLB.TV player UI
AND the user taps the device back button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the chromecast selector overlay will disappear
AND the stream will continue to play uninterrupted

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Chromecast button on the MLB.TV player UI
And the user selects a Chromecast device from the selector
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should begin playing on the chromecast device
And the user should be left on the video player controls on their handset

title: Splash screen on Chromecast device when connected
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on a network with a Chromecast device
And the user is on the EPG
custom_steps: When the user connects to the Chromecast device
custom_expected: Then the MLB.com splash screen will appear on the connected display

title: Backgrounding & killing app while casting
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
And the user is casting an MLB.TV stream to a chromecast device

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Home' button on the handset
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to their homescreen, and the stream should continue to play on their chromecast device
And the user should be able to user their device normally while the stream continues to play

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user backgrounds and kills the At Bat app on the handset
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the stream should continue to play on the Chromecast *as long as chromecast is still connected to a network*

title: Casting device disconnects from network
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
And the user has started a casting an MLB.TV stream to a chromecast device
custom_steps: When the user disconnects the handset from the network to which the Chromecast is connected
custom_expected: Then the stream should continue to play on the Chromecast

title: Switching feeds while casting
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
And the user is connected to a Chromecast device
And the user is streaming an MLB.TV stream through Chromecast
custom_steps: When the user changes feeds in the video control player
custom_expected:
Then the Stream should stop on the Chromecast device
And a blackout check, entitlement check and mediaframework authorization will occur on the handset for the new stream. 
And when all of those succeed, the stream should begin playing on the Chromecast device

title: Backing out of cast controls screen
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
And the user is casting an MLB.TV stream to a chromecast device
And the user is on the MLB.TV screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the back button on the device
custom_expected:
Then the stream should continue playing on the chromecast device
And the user should be returned to the EPG on their handset
And the user should remain connected to the chromecast device. (Chromecast icon should remain white on handset)

title: Returning to At Bat while casting
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
And the user has started a chromecast stream
And the user is on the Cast Controls screen
And the user has navigated out of At Bat to their home screen or another app
custom_steps: When the user returns to At Bat no matter how they launched it. (App switching, home screen icon, widget, notification etc)
custom_expected:
Then the user should be taken directly into the video player controls screen
And the stream should continue playing on the chromecast device
And the user should have full control of the streaming content on the Chromecast device

title: Disconnecting while casting
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
And the user is streaming an MLB.TV stream on chromecast device
And the user is on the video control screen
custom_steps:
When the user taps the Chromecast button on the player UI
And the user taps the 'Disconnect' button on the overlay
custom_expected:
Then the stream will stop on the Chromecast device
And the chromecast will be disconnected from the app

title: CC button
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
And the user is connected to a Chromecast device
And the user has started an MLB.TV stream on the chromecast device

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user enables the Closed Captioning setting on the player UI on the handset
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the closed captions should be enabled on the chromecast stream

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user disables the Closed Captioning setting on the player UI on the handset
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the closed captions should turn off on the chromecast stream

title: CC setting carries from handset to cast device
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is streaming an MLB.TV stream on the handset
And the user has Closed Captions turned on for that stream
custom_steps: When the begins to cast that stream
custom_expected: Then the stream should maintain the Closed Captioning setting being used and should carry over to the chromecast stream. (ie. If CC is turned on, the stream should have closed captions on the chromecast display)

title: Notification
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
And the user is connected to a network with a chromecast device
And the user begins streaming an MLB.TV stream to a Chromecast device

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user backgrounds the app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a notification should appear on their device's top status bar
And this notification should have playback controls for the casting MLB.TV stream

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user expands the notification in the notification tray
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the expanded notification cast controls should appear

title: Collapsed Notification View
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed 
And the user is casting a game to a chromecast device
custom_steps: When the notification is in a collapsed view

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Names
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team names should be accurate
And the order should be [Away team] @ [Home team]

custom_steps_separated.content: Connected Cast Device
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the device that is being casted to should appear correctly on the notification

custom_steps_separated.content: Cast Controls
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the play/pause button should appear on the right side of the notification 
And there should be an "X" to the right of the play/pause button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Pause' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream should pause
And the 'Pause' button should change into a 'Play' button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Play' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the stream should resume from the point from which is was paused

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'X' button on the notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream should stop on the chromecast device
And if the user starts the At Bat app they should not be taken to the cast controls

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken into the At Bat app to the Cast Controls page
And the MLB.TV stream should continue to play on the chromecast device

title: Expanded Notification View
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed 
And the user is casting a game to a chromecast device
custom_steps: When the notification is in an expanded view

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Names
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team names should be accurate
And the order should be [Away team] @ [Home team]

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Logos
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team logos should be accurate
And the order should be [Away team] followed by [Home team]

custom_steps_separated.content: Connected Cast Device
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the device that is being casted to should appear correctly on the notification

custom_steps_separated.content: Cast Controls
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then there should be a volume button
And there should be a play/pause button
And there should be an "x" button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Mute' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream audio should be muted on the chromecast device
And the button on the notification should reflect that audio has been muted

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'unMute' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream audio should resume on the chromecast device
And the button on the notification should reflect that audio has been unmuted

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Pause' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream should pause
And the 'Pause' button should change into a 'Play' button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Play' button on the notification
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the stream should resume from the point from which is was paused

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'X' button on the notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream should stop on the chromecast device
And if the user starts the At Bat app they should not be taken to the cast controls

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken into the At Bat app to the Cast Controls page
And the MLB.TV stream should continue to play on the chromecast device
